scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. One of the team members, Alex, says, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time.' You responded by suggesting breaking the tasks into smaller parts. The team seemed somewhat relieved but still on edge. [Monica] and [Bob] exchange concerned looks. Monica then speaks up, 'Even with smaller tasks, the deadline is still too tight.' Bob, looking frustrated, adds, 'I don't think anyone here believes we can actually pull this off.' You then acknowledged the team's feelings and opened the floor for discussion. Now, Monica sighs and says, 'Even if we discuss our concerns, the time isn't going to magically expand.' Bob, rubbing his temples, mutters, 'This is just going to be a disaster waiting to happen.' You then opened the floor for suggestions but also pushed the team to continue working. Bob, feeling the pressure, stands up and paces around the room, and Monica crosses her arms tightly. Monica, with a hint of sarcasm, says, 'Well, since we have all the time in the world, why don't we just brainstorm some more?' You addressed Monica's sarcasm directly and pushed the team to continue working. Now, Monica rolls her eyes and slumps into her chair, while Bob clenches his fists.
scenes.description: Monica, sounding defeated, says, 'Fine, let's just get this over with.' Bob, shaking his head, adds, 'This is going to be a nightmare.'

options.text: I understand it's tough, but let's focus on one task at a time. We can do this if we stay organized.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the difficulty but encouraged the team to stay organized and focused, showing good emotional perception and self-regulation.

options.text: I get it, this isn't easy. But if we keep complaining, it'll only make things worse. Let's just start working.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the team's frustration but pushed them to stop complaining and start working, showing moderate emotion perception and motivation.

options.text: If this is really how you feel, maybe we should reconsider if we can actually meet this deadline.
options.analysis: You showed empathy by considering the team's feelings about the deadline but also raised doubt about meeting it, showing moderate emotional perception and empathy.
